intro: Esenbeckia kallunkiae, commonly known as the Kallunkia esenbeckia, is a flowering plant native to the arid regions of South America. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, with woody stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are yellow and occur in clusters, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Esenbeckia kallunkiae is adapted to survive in dry environments, with deep roots and a capacity to store water in its tissues.
